adventure_overview: We have three important resources for all living things on our planet: water, soil, and air. We use water to clean ourselves, our dishes, and our clothes. Soil is the resource that allows us to grow food. The air we breathe goes into our lungs, providing our bloodstream with oxygen. In this Adventure, you’ll discover more about the resources of water, soil, and air and perhaps put what you discover into use with a conservation project. Knowing more about the resources of the planet will help you make good decisions about conserving the resources of our world. Prior to any activity, use the Scouting AmericaSAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Discover what happens to the wastewater in your community.

activities.name: Water Conservation Charades
activities.description: Cub Scouts will learn ways of conserving water by playing charades.

activities.name: Water Management Facility Tour
activities.description: Cub Scouts tour their local  ​ ​ water management facility.

activities.name: Where Does Wastewater Go?
activities.description: Cub Scouts make a poster showing what happens to wastewater in their community.

activities.name: Bears Plant Trees
activities.description: Cub Scouts plant trees for a local organization.

activities.name: Clean Waterways
activities.description: In celebration of the 70th anniversary of the Conservation Good Turn for America, Scouting America is joining the nationwide initiative aimed at addressing the critical issue of waterway and marine debris, “aquatic trash”, offering Scouts the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the health of our waterways and ecosystems.

activities.name: Planting Native Plants
activities.description: Cub Scouts will add native plants to a garden for the chartered partner, school, or other community location.
